item.title: this is aaronland: i like dots <-- cheap and cheerful e-ink displays for museums and other applications
item.description:
• As always aaron in i like dots has something well worth reading!
  • e-ink + raspberry pi = amazing displays for museums and many other things! (aaron was part of the early pre-yahoo vancouver flickr crew in 2005 and that’s when i met him and i’ve been following him and the other flickr folks ever since)

item.title: There's more to life than being a weirdo, being normal or showing your work aka not sure what to make of Meredith L. Patterson's: When Nerds Collide My intersectionality will have weirdoes or it will be bullshit
item.description:
• There’s more to life than being a weirdo, being normal or showing your work aka not sure what to make of Meredith L. Patterson’s: When Nerds Collide My intersectionality will have weirdoes or it will be bullshit (via Richard’s tweet)
    • e.g. walking, bicycling, doing nothing just for the sake of doing nothing, etc
  • writing code seemed weird back in 1977 to me, now it’s been corrupted by both “weirdos” and “normals” to make the miasma of the internet
    • weirdo is the new normal if you ask me and that’s not 100% a good thing! because decency is not weird often and mundanity is often better than being weird!

item.title: Nick Punt::Mea Culpa::Add a User Interface for admitting mistakes and forgiving those who make mistakes to social media like twitter in order to de-escalate
item.description:
• “In summary, the Mea Culpa idea involves three changes on Twitter:

    1. Add the ability to admit a mistake, which shuts down tweet amplification

    2. Add corrections in the home feeds of those who reacted to it, which helps inform readers so they may adjust what they feel about the poster and may become better informed

    3. Add a way to forgive the poster for those who reacted, which creates an incentive to admit mistakes in the future, and helps repair any relationship damage between people” <– Love this idea from Nick Punt::De-Escalating Social Media Designing humility and forgiveness into social media products

item.title: My pink petal project mask arrived! it's great! Go get your own, $5 goes to Hogan's Alley Society
item.description:
• My pink petal project mask arrived! it’s great! Pls click here: https://artofwhere.com/artists/roland-tanglao/accessories/face-covering/3502516 to get your own, $5 goes to Hogan’s Alley Society
    • Previously: June-August 2020: 100% of my profits from Art of Where tights and masks will be donated to the Hogan’s Alley Society

item.title: The whole miasma of the internet has blocked me from blogging but not for long :-)
item.description: • Miasma is a term from Stephenson’s Fall, or Dodge in Hell which I loved!

item.title: NEW Pink Petal Mask added using thumbnails instead of patches: again 100% of my profits from Art of Where tights and masks will be donated to the Hogan's Alley Society

item.title: June-August 2020: 100% of my profits from Art of Where tights and masks will be donated to the Hogan's Alley Society
item.description:
• Edit July 5, 2020. Profit for masks is actually $CDN 5 not CDN $10. Thanks to the two folks who bought a mask in June!
  • For June-August 2020: 100% of my profits from Art of Where tights (approx $CDN 14) and masks (approx $CDN 510del) will be donated to the Hogan’s Alley Society

item.title: How To get a list of escalated Firefox Desktop Support Questions
item.description:
• From the rt-kits-api2 README:
cd 202006
../get-by-updated-time-question-url-answers-for-arbitrary-time-period.rb \
2020 6 22 2020 6 25
cd ..
grep "escalate;" \
202006/updated-2020-06-22-2020-06-25-ff-desktop-creator-answers-desktop-all-locales.csv\
| ./with-title-email-escalations.rb
